data.title: Bitcoin soars to $104,000, up 126% since January 1
data.description: The price of Bitcoin hit US$100,000 for the first time in history on Thursday, thanks to demand from Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), which has led to tightening of supply after Bitcoin’s fourth halving in April and Donald Trump's US election win.

data.title: NACC mulls taking up case querying Thaksin’s preferential treatment
data.description: The case, filed by the National Human Rights Commission, accuses officials of abusing their authority by allowing Thaksin to stay in a VIP hospital suite instead of serving time in prison

data.title: Bangkokians invited to admire Jupiter in ‘Starry Night’ event
data.description: 100 telescopes will be made available for stargazers at Benjakitti Park on Saturday to get a close look at the planet’s clouds, storms and its four Galilean moons

data.title: SRT runs special Bangkok-Chachoengsao train to celebrate Father’s Day
data.description: World War II locomotives pressed into service

data.title: Hilltribe girls ‘lured into selling sex to Chinese customers’
data.description: Two young women have been arrested separately for their alleged involvement in luring 25 underage tribal girls from northern Thailand into selling sex to Chinese customers in Bangkok.

data.title: ALRO investigates VIP land deal in Saraburi
data.description: The investigation follows complaints about the land being misused for non-agricultural purposes, including resort and tourist activities

data.title: UnitedHealthcare CEO kept a low public profile. Then he was shot to death in New York
data.description: Brian Thompson led one of the biggest health insurers in the US but was unknown to millions of people his decisions affected.

data.title: Rare tapir seen in Kaeng Krachan park
data.description: A rare sighting of a  tapir  has been reported at  Kaeng Krachan  National Park in Phetchaburi.

data.title: NACC prodded over delay in high-profile Saraburi land-grab case
data.description: Anti-Corruption Commission insists it will not be swayed by rumours that suspect is high-flying Army LT-colonel and TV presenter with romantic links to former deputy PM

data.title: Chinese researchers tout ‘invisibility’ breakthrough
data.description: BEIJING - Chinese researchers say they have developed a material that quickly changes colour at a molecular level based on the surrounding light, creating a new form of camouflage that could help people blend into their environments — much like a chameleon.

data.title: TAT projects 40 million foreign tourists in 2025, revenue to rise 7.5%
data.description: Foreign arrivals in Thailand are expected to reach 40 million in 2025 following the government’s measures to stimulate the economy and tourism, according to the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT).

data.title: Criminal probe sought against Malaysian ex-PM Mahathir
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - A Malaysian royal commission studying cases involving three disputed islets in the Singapore Strait has proposed a criminal investigation against former prime minister Mahathir Mohamad, the state news agency Bernama reported on Thursday.

data.title: Buddha’s tooth relic arrives in Bangkok
data.description: China temporarily transfers the relic to Thailand as the two countries celebrate half a century of diplomatic relations

data.title: Beyoncé crowned the pop star of the 21st century by Billboard
data.description: Billboard: Beyonce takes her throne, the best artist of the 21st century, winning Taylor Swift and Rihanna.

data.title: Drunk Benz driver kills motorcyclist
data.description: A drunk executive of a well-known cosmetic clinic was arrested in Bangkok after his Mercedes-Benz struck a parcel delivery rider, knocking her off a flyover onto Rama IV Road below, where she died.

data.title: PM leads ceremony to mark beloved late king’s birthday
data.description: Representatives of government, judiciary, Parliament and security forces gather at Sanam Luang to mark Father’s Day

data.title: Nation Group celebrates King Rama IX’s musical genius with ‘HM Blues’
data.description: Nation Group and its partners hosted a concert titled “HM Blues” to mark His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej the Great’s birthday, National Day and Father’s Day on Wednesday.

data.title: Beauty queen meets buffalo beauties on visit to Bangkok
data.description: In Thailand for her fourth visit, Miss Universe Victoria Kjær Theilvig was reportedly delighted to meet and greet buffaloes Koh Muang Phet and Labubu at Phra Arthit Mansion in Bangkok’s Phra Nakhon district on Wednesday.

data.title: Ubon Art Fest 2024 lays out a feast of art and culture
data.description: From Dec-15, visitors can enjoy three days of art, competitions, music, shopping and tasty Isaan cuisine

data.title: Tourism Authority expects 1.56 million foreign arrivals for New Year
data.description: Thailand is expected to generate 62 billion baht in tourism revenue from Thai and foreign travellers during the New Year festival, up 23% year-on-year, the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) said on Thursday.

data.title: Cheaper domestic flights up for grabs
data.description: National airline offers 8,000 flights to major domestic destinations over New Year holidays at a 30% discount

data.title: South Korea's Yoon replaces defense chief amid looming impeachment vote
data.description: South Korea’s president accepted the resignation of his defense minister Thursday as opposition parties moved to impeach both men over the stunning yet short-lived imposition of martial law that brought armed troops into Seoul streets.

data.title: People's Party urges action to curb PM2.5
data.description: The People

data.title: Ho Chi Minh City promises to be bridge between Vietnam, Thailand
data.description: HCM City will be an active bridge to foster friendship and close cooperation between Vietnam and Thailand, a city leader has pledged.

data.title: Vietnam rises to the top 11 largest exporters globally
data.description: According to the World Trade Organisation (WTO), Vietnam has advanced significantly in import-export rankings and now stands second in ASEAN, trailing only Singapore.

data.title: JAT-NB3 Set for Exciting Year-End Showdown in Thailand
data.description: The Junior Asian Tour (JAT) – Notah Begay III (NB3) series is gearing up for its fourth tournament of 2024, promising an intense and thrilling contest to cap off the year. The event, scheduled from December 6-8, will take place at the picturesque Lotus Valley Golf Resort in Chachoengsao.

data.title: Viet Nam rises to the top 11 largest exporters globally
data.description: According to the World Trade Organisation (WTO), Viet Nam has advanced significantly in import-export rankings and now stands second in ASEAN, trailing only Singapore.
